title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) — In a performance that defied the grind of a long season and evoked memories of his prime, Hakeem Olajuwon authored a masterpiece. The Houston Rockets’ legendary center poured in a staggering 42 points, single-handedly dismantling the San Antonio Spurs in a commanding 112-87 victory.

From the opening tip, it was clear this was Olajuwon’s night. The Spurs had no answer for "The Dream's" arsenal of unstoppable post moves, feathery-soft jump hooks, and commanding presence on the block. Each possession became a clinic in fundamental brilliance, as Olajuwon carved up the San Antonio defense with a historic, virtuoso performance.

While Olajuwon’s 42 points were the engine of the rout, he was far from a one-man show. Charles Barkley provided the muscle and secondary scoring with 19 points, a perfect complement to the finesse of Olajuwon. The backcourt, led by Matt Maloney’s 14 points and 9 assists, expertly fed the hot hand, ensuring the offense ran through their dominant big man.

The Spurs, simply overwhelmed, were led by Tim Duncan’s 17 points, but the rookie sensation was rendered a spectator to the Olajuwon showcase. San Antonio’s offense never found a consistent rhythm against a locked-in Rockets defense.

On this night, however, every other stat was a footnote. The final score, the supporting contributions, all paled in comparison to the number 42 next to Olajuwon’s name. It was a vintage display of greatness, a reminder of his singular talent, and the primary reason the Rockets cruised to a decisive win that will be remembered not for the margin, but for the man who defined it.
